result.execSummary:
The defendant Steward B McKibbins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 475 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

records.addlTxt: filed by the state
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Steward B McKibbins in court, in custody, with Attorney Peter M Wolff.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Counts #2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Wolff makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 475 days)
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS  OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $1,785.46 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -  restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 23, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Steward B McKibbins in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel just received a offer from the state and they are requesting plea and sentencing date as soon as possible.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 3/12/16 requesting bail reduction.

Reviewed by Judge Maxwell 3/15/16.  No action taken.  Defendant represented by counsel.
Hearing at 03-21-2016 02:00 pm

Defendant Steward B McKibbins in court, in custody by video from Kettle Moraine Correctional, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel needs time to go and speak with his client and also stated that there is no offer at this time. State to route the file to the attorney to see if there is a offer. Court adjourns the matter for 30 days for the status of any offer. Defendant stated that he will be in the Waukesha County Jail for the next hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
